result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda Nmi Allison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and Consecutive to Case 16CM1536.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $267.92 to be paid to Citgo.  Bail applied to restitution.  Remainder of restitution to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with any merchants listed in the criminal complaint.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Jury trial - 12 person on August 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Linda Nmi Allison in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The court addresses the Defendant's non compliance with WCS.  Attorney Weitzner provides a statement.  The Court schedules 15CM1686 for jury trial and all other cases to tag along and be scheduled for a hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2017 at 10:30 am.
